FuncDef:
The ds-lite user-session create-rate command sets the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a DS-Lite device.
The undo ds-lite user-session create-rate command restores the default rate.
By default, the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on the centralized-boards is 64 kpps.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a DS-Lite device.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 64, in kpps. The default value is 64.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a DS-Lite device, run the ds-lite user-session create-rate command. If the rate at which packets are sent exceeds the configured rate, excess packets are discarded.
Prerequisites
A DS-Lite instance has been created, and the DS-Lite session number limit function has been enabled. By default, the limit function is enabled.
Precautions
The ds-lite user-session create-rate command takes effect only on VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
